meanings.definition: To damage or remove the myelin sheath from nerve fibers.
meanings.sent1: The disease can demyelinate the nerves, causing communication issues.
meanings.sent2: Doctors are studying how certain substances can demyelinate nerve cells.
meanings.sent3: When the prankster spilled glue on the wires, he accidentally demyelinated them!
meanings.sent4: The harsh chemicals acted like a corrosive force, seeking to demyelinate the delicate nerves.
meanings.sent5: The image of the myelin sheath being stripped away by the disease is truly unsettling.

meanings.definition: The process of losing the protective covering of nerve fibers.
meanings.sent1: After the injury, the demyelinate of the nerves was evident in the tests.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are investigating the causes of demyelinate in certain neurological disorders.
meanings.sent3: The demyelinate of the wires made the electrical system malfunction comically.
meanings.sent4: The gradual demyelinate of trust between them was heartbreaking to witness.
meanings.sent5: The vulnerability exposed by the demyelinate of the nerves was a stark reminder of fragility.
